summary: This document is an email chain between legal counsel regarding a subpoena (CRIM 1031692) issued to Amazon. The correspondence discusses scheduling follow-up calls, the death of Jeffrey Epstein, and legal issues related to the subpoena's scope, including First Amendment considerations and the breadth of requests for account information linked to specific addresses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein' in the context of his death impacting First Amendment considerations related to a subpoena for Amazon records.

events.title: Email regarding subpoena handoff
events.description: An email indicates a colleague is taking over handling of the subpoena due to the sender's upcoming trial, and discusses issues including First Amendment considerations after Epstein's death and the overbreadth of the request.

events.title: Scheduling email for subpoena discussion
events.description: An email proposes a call for Thursday, August 22, 2019, at 10:30am PT to discuss the subpoena.

keyFacts: A subpoena (CRIM 1031692) was issued to Amazon, likely as part of the Epstein investigation.
The death of Jeffrey Epstein raised First Amendment considerations regarding the subpoena's requests.
Legal counsel discussed the overbreadth of requests for 'all information for all accounts having ever shipped to, or billed in connection with, the listed addresses.'
The correspondence involves an Associate General Counsel for Litigation & Regulatory matters at Amazon, based in Seattle.
The document shows ongoing legal proceedings and evidence gathering related to the Epstein case after his death.
